Name: Figure of the god Horus in roman military costume
Description: Small bronze figure of Horus, the ancient Egyptian god of kingship. In this image from the early Roman Period, perhaps first or second century AD, he retains his falcon head but is given the garb and gesture of the triumphant emperor. This type of mixed art provoked the anger and derision of writers at Rome, but enjoyed great popularity in Egypt and across the Roman Empire.
